fields.summary: Remove hostile-attachments-confif.properties and move it into the main applications properties

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24714].
  {panel}

Please, refer the attached screenshot:
!Screenshot-4.png!

In the footer of all Jira pages there's an option: "Contact Administrators". When click on that, it's expected get a list of all administrators of the system, but this list only will be populated in case of the option *jira.paths.set.allowed* be allowed inside {{$JIRA_INSTALL/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/jira-application.properties}}.

From version 4.1.1 Jira comes with this option disabled due to the following security vulnerability: [XSS and Privilege Escalation Vulnerabilities in JIRA|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-21004] which is acceptable so far. However, the link keeps appearing on the page even though does not working.

*The chief concern is: If this option wont work, it also should  not appear on the page footer.*
fields.summary: "Contact Administrators" footer link should not appear if "jira.paths.set.allowed" is set false
Include Issue ID in REST API
Make multi-selection consistent.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24687].
  {panel}

In JIRA version 4.2.4 there is an "Assign To Me" button in the issue details screen which allows the user to change the issue's assignee value without going through one of the user defined workflow steps.  This defeats the purpose of having configurable workflows steps since the user is able to change the state of the issue outside of the workflow.  There should be a way to configure JIRA so that this button can be hidden or disabled.

An admin should also have the ability to hide the Assign menu button on the top of a ticket for the same purposes as listed above. If a user wants to only have the assignee determined by a workflow, this hinders that ability.

*Workaround:*
For JIRA Server: Go to Admin, Plugins, System Plugins, Issue Operations Plugin, Manage plugin modules. Find the module named "View Issue Ops Bar Assign To Me Link (assign-to-me)" and click on the Disable button. The "Assign To Me" button will now not be displayed when viewing any issue.
This is not available on JIRA Cloud because System Plugins are restricted.
fields.summary: Provide ability to hide or disable Assign To Me button
REST API: allow admin user to operate as a different user
Prevent users from putting HTML in their Full Name
GET resource for workflows and transitions
POST resource to add a comment
Gravatar support
Expand "WAS" JQL operator to support fixVersion
JQL query to return certain issues and (only) THEIR children. (Make the argument of JQL operator "IN" able to be an evaluated expression.)
JIRA fires out duplicated filter subscription email to users if the users are a member of multiple groups, and the groups are subscribed to the filter

Would be great to have it in 4.4.
fields.summary: Add to and modify tickets change history through SOAP

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24630].
  {panel}

As of now, View -> Excel (All Fields) doesn't export any of the details of the Activity Section of a JIRA.

We are specifically interested in the Source Tab of the Activity Section, as Source tab lists the changeset
details (files checked in corresponding to a JIRA fix).
Kindly add an option in JIRA so that Activity section details of a JIRA can be searched, extracted/exported.
JQL also doesn't list Activity in it's Fields Reference.
This feature is highly desired, as it would let us get the complete export of information associated with a JIRA.
Request you to let us know when can this be made available in JIRA

(Outlook mail thread of Support request raised for this issue is attached)
fields.summary: Activity Section details export option required in JIRA
As a User I can search for all issues that have been cloned.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24628].
  {panel}

Here are the following steps on how to reproduce this problem:
*Using JIRA 4.3.x*:
# Log in to JIRA
# Create a sample issue in Testing project (e.g:TST-1 - http://localhost:8071/browse/TST-1)
# Go to _Administration -> Global Settings -> Trackbacks_ and make sure that 'Accept Incoming Trackback Pings' is being set to *ON*
# Startup *Confluence 3.5.x* server
# Create a sample page in a testing space
# Navigate to _Browse -> Confluence Admin -> Configuration -> General Configuration_ 
# Check on 'Trackback' option
# Use this link - http://10.60.1.173:8071/browse/TST-1 and paste it to the Confluence page that just being created
# Go back to JIRA page and click on Refresh
|

*No trackback ping is shown at all*. Bidirectional Application Links using Trusted Apps have already being set up on both JIRA and Confluence and yet, not working. *This problem does not happen using any Confluence version of 3.4.x and below with JIRA 4.2.x and below*. See this screenshot:
!Trackback_Works.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Trackback Links does not work in JIRA 4.3.x with Confluence 3.5.x
Streamline Move Issue Process

WebworkService - actionMapper  com.atlassian.seraph.util.CachedPathMapper is 7MB in size

Its seems to have included every URL every seen.  Is this delibreate?

eg key  java.lang.String "/32680_bullet_creme.gif", key  java.lang.String "/JRA-3476", key  java.lang.String "/ConfluenceActionSupport_de_DE.properties"


We should use a LRU map in some way to limit how big this gets

https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/JIRA+4.3+Heap+Dump+Staring
fields.summary: WebworkService cache mapper is unbounded in size and keeps every URL it has ever seen.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24600].
  {panel}

Admin Story:

"I am looking at 100 custom fields. How can I find which plugin provides the custom field type for a particular field?"

An admin would want to do this to work out how to disable a specific custom field without removing it and losing the data in it. Or they may want to work out which support organization to contact about a bug with the field.

At the moment they could grep the plugin jar files for the name of the custom field type (not always successful) or go to the database (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Database+Schema#DatabaseSchema-Customfields) and get the CUSTOMFIELDTYPEKEY (but there may even be two custom field types with the same name). Given the plugin key they need to look at the vendors for an idea or grep the plugin jar files again.

One way to provide this information to an admin would be to make the custom field type names listed at Admin, Custom Field into links to the UPM and the specific plugin module that provides the given custom field type. This would work for the standard custom field types too.
fields.summary: Input for any Admin, Custom Fields UX changes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24576].
  {panel}

Currently if you type "some text" in the quick search box, it generates this jql

summary ~ "some text" OR description ~ "some text" OR comment ~ "some text"


But then this hard to quickly change and refine the search, especially if you type it in wrong (3 strings to edit and all)

It would be better of it generated

text ~ "some text"


I spoke the Brenden Bain about this and he said the reason they did it originally what that summary,description and comment where the original quick text semantics.  

But that 'text' also support custom fields and hence is semantically different.

But I argue that the benefit of "edit ability" is greater than the semantic preservation.
fields.summary: Change the quick search JQL generation to just 'text'
Create a me() synonym function for currentUser()

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24572].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 24 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi All,

Thank you for your votes and comments on this feature request and also on the linked issues.

I am happy to announce that JIRA 6.4 has implemented pagination, search and filtering by project category on Browse Projects page.

Cheers,

Eve Stankiewicz
JIRA Product Management
{panel}

*Original request description:*

Hi Atlassian,

We are currently working on a large enterprise project management system and are hoping to make JIRA a core component of this system. We envision that JIRA will end up with thousands of projects (ballpark figure of about 10,000 projects). However, it would appear that JIRA was not designed to scale to this number of projects and we would like to request some new features in JIRA to support this number of projects. 

These requests are based on our findings of running a JIRA instance with 12,000 projects (this was created using a modified version of your jmeter-test-setup.jmx performance testing script).

Feature Request 1:
Add pagination support to the 'View all Projects' page both under the Projects tab and the Administration page. 

As you can imagine, with 12,000 projects these pages take too long to load making project selection extremely difficult. Pagination would enable a user to browse a large number of projects without excessive load times.


Feature Request 2:
Add some filter controls on the 'View all Projects' page. 

Even with pagination, searching thousands of projects would be tedious. Thus if we could get filters, even if it were just a name based filter, that would be most welcome.


Regards,
  -George Clernon
fields.summary: Pagination and Filtering of Project Browser index pages when JIRA has thousands of projects
Assigning an issue while transitioning the workflow should fire a Issue Assigned event.
Make "task progress" and "sub-task progress" avaliable to display the amount of hours per person
Show status of linked issue(s) in search (Issue Navigator )

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24547].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 3rd September 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}

Hi everyone,

In the new issue view you can now drag and drop subtasks in all issue detail view (board, backlog, full page, issue navigator). You can see the linked video in the attachments for how this works. Therefore, I am marking this issue as complete.

The new issue view has been rolled out to all Jira Software cloud customers with the ability for each user to individually toggle it off or on. You need to have the new issue view toggled on to have this functionality. 

It should be noted however, that drag and drop for issues within an epic will *not* work. This is due to the fact that regular issue types - e.g. stories, bug, task - are tied into the global rank which can affect your backlog list. The subtask issue type(s) did not have this problem as they were not tied to the global rank. For example, if you moved the list of stories under an epic around, it would affect how those issues are represented in your backlog inadvertently and ways you may not have intended, causing confusion. We are designing the best experience for being able to drag and drop issues within an epic, while taking this into account. This will be shipped at some point in the future - no timeline yet unfortunately. 

I have created a separate issue to track that functionality specifically. https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-72887


Regards,
 Taylor Pechacek
 tpechacek (at) atlassian (dot) com
 Product Manager, Jira Cloud
{panel}
Should be a way to move the subtasks up or down with a drag and drop feature instead of one row at a time. When there are an extensive amount of subtasks it is cumbersome and time consuming to move subtasks up or down one row at a time. Having a drag and drop feature would allow for quicker organization of the subtasks.
fields.summary: Drag and Drop Subtasks
Improve on the way JIRA handles the Crowd Integration
Fix multiple web resource transformations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24539].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

    Go to the user profile page.
    Click the edit icon in the preferences panel.
    Change some preferences and click save.

Result:

In IE8, the form is submitted causing a page load. Upon loading, there is no "settings have been updated" message.

Expected result:

As in non-IE browsers, the form data is sent via ajax, and a "settings have been updated" message is displayed.


https://jdog.atlassian.com/browse/JRADEV-5457
fields.summary: Update User Preferences dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24529].
  {panel}

Unable to access Jira after setting an unauthorized account to run the tomcat service. The account had to be set to be allowed to run a service.

The message I got told me that the Jira was unable to clear the Felix cache in the osg.plugins directory. From the Atlassian docs I found on the net this message meant that perhaps there was something wrong with the network performance or perhaps there was more than one instance of jira or as it said in the doc "Confluense" ( Anyway a Atlassian prod ) pointing at the same HOME directory. This doc should be updated with the problem I have found or this specific problem should have it´s own more clear fail message.

After setting the permissions to run service for the account all was fine and OK.




Link to doc with the incomplete text:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=223219172
fields.summary: Wrong fail message when setting an unauthorized service account to run the tomcat service (KB article)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24522].
{panel}
{panel:title=Status Update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
We are in the process of rolling out an entirely new issue detail view for Jira Cloud, across all products. This new issue experience has been completely redesigned and includes a single status transition button with a drop-down, which will show all status's and/or all transitions --> status if you have multiple transitions to a single status within your workflow. The ordering is just alphabetical within each status category (to do, in progress, done).

The new issue view is available to all Jira users. You can enable it by going to your personal settings, then scrolling down to find a Jira Labs section and enabling it.

Workflow transitions and status are a key part of any Jira issue, so our aim was to make it much more prominent, easier to understand, and easier to update when you want to make a change. You can read more about all the new features here:
 - [The new Jira issue view - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/the-new-jira-issue-view-938040503.html#ThenewJiraissueview-Simpletransitions.]

If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to ask. I will be closing this issue as it should be addressed by the new issue view. Thanks!

Taylor Pechacek, 
 Jira Cloud PM
{panel}

Per [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Workflow#ConfiguringWorkflow-Changingthenumberoftransitionbuttons] one has to edit the jira-application.properties file to modify the number of workflow transition that show on issue screens. This request is for the ability to modify this behavior in the admin UI.

It would also be beneficial if customers could change the Ops Bar Action icons in addition to the workflow transition buttons. I.E. be able to view 'clone' or 'attach files' as a button instead of in the list of it's a heavily used function.

 

*Note:* 
 # Modifications in the  {{jira-config.properties}} file is not supported in Cloud.
fields.summary: Allow Configuration of the Number of Workflow Transition Buttons Through the UI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24521].
  {panel}

A user can specify the sort order (latest first, oldest first) on the Comments tab. But somehow, JIRA loses this choice (logout maybe?).
The sort order can be set by an Admin, but not overruled by a user itself.

The wish here is to be able to remember the sort order on the useraccount setting.

Business context:
* managers like to see the most recent on top of the tab
* developers like to see the most recent at the bottom of the whole page
fields.summary: Sort order preference of Comments, Sources, etc is reset. Could be a user setting instead.
JIRA should support the use of TLS - SNI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24507].
  {panel}

Some customers don't have any longer a need for Crowd as the new user management framework (JIRA 4.3+) is sufficient for their needs.

They would benefit from an import tool that allows import users & groups to JIRA. 

Tool that would work similar to the Crowd importer, but the other way around.

!http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/30736459/Import+-+JIRA.png?version=1&modificationDate=1203400551966!

For users with programming experience a possible workaround is to use Crowd's REST API for the export and JIRA's API for the import.
fields.summary: Create Crowd users importer to JIRA
Most users won't be able to generate thread dumps on window with help of our doco

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24505].
  {panel}

As of JIRA 4.3 the application is able to generate thread dumps on some predefined events. This work was done as [JRA-15470|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-15470].

Support would really benefit from streamlining the process of generating thread dumps. Current process to some extend is to difficult to follow for inexperienced users.

Following Confluence we could implement simple UI similar to:

!http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/188095/confluence-3-0-thread-dump-generation.png?version=1&modificationDate=1243657619810!

and similar scheduling:
!http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/188095/confluence-3-0-thread-dump-scheduling.png?version=1&modificationDate=1243657618019!
fields.summary: Abilty to generate thread dumps from  UI
Two identical issue created,while I clicked twice on "create" button. Disable or put grey color the button.
The control of the calendar widget always highlight the value that has been currently set

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24482].
  {panel}

Problem: When I am looking at an EPIC (using Greenhopper) in the traditional view
(i.e. https://myserver/jira/browse/PROJECT-1234) It would be very helpful if this view could also contain
the related stories - much like linked issues is working today.

Basically the view that you get if you click on the epic link in the Greenhopper task board view, where you
get the stories and tasks related to that epic.
fields.summary: see linked stories when looking at an epic story in traditional jira view.

  {panel}

Lack of referential integrity in online calculator.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open online calculator.
2. Alternately insert numerals from 0 to 9. (0123456789)

Expected result:
1. Dialog box shows 0123456789

Actual result:
1. Dialog box shows 4930715286 (see pic. calculator.jpg)

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

Steps:
1. Setup a new instance of JIRA.
2. Login as Sysadmin. Goto admin page and there is no project right now.
3. Click on "Add Project". 

Result:
1. User is asked to enter password.
2. As a user first time setting JIRA, this is not very user friendly experience.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24433].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

# Change your browser/OS settings so that the tab key will focus links.
# Open a dialog with form fields inside it, e.g. log work. The first field is automatically focused.
# Press tab. The next form field (if one exists) is focused.
# GOTO 3.

Expected result:

At some point, the cancel link should be focused.

Observed result:

The cancel link never gets focus. Shift+tab, option+tab, etc. don't focus the cancel link either, even though they will focus other links, like date pickers, comment security level, etc.
fields.summary: Cannot focus cancel link with keyboard in dialogs
Add Support For Multiple Bug Import Id Custom Fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24420].
  {panel}

Now that there are platform-specific installers for Windows and OSX, how about cleaning up what is packaged in the {{bin}} directory for Linux?
There are 13 .bat files that are just clutter in there.

{code}
[mdoar@mdoar2-3 bin]$ ls
bootstrap.jar         jsvc.tar.gz           startup.bat
catalina-tasks.xml    permgen.bat           startup.sh*
catalina.bat          permgen.sh*           tomcat-juli.jar
catalina.sh*          permgenservice.bat    tomcat-native.tar.gz
commons-daemon.jar    service.bat           tomcat6.exe
config.bat            setclasspath.bat      tomcat6w.exe
config.sh*            setclasspath.sh*      tool-wrapper.bat
cpappend.bat          setenv.bat            tool-wrapper.sh*
digest.bat            setenv.sh*            version.bat
digest.sh*            shutdown.bat          version.sh*
jirabanner.txt        shutdown.sh*
{code}
fields.summary: Clean up the bin directory for each platform
The Screenshot For Restoring a Project from Backup Documentation Should Be Updated To Avoid Confusion

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24414].
  {panel}

Hello,

I would have created a Bug issue type but by reading the thread of the original source of this issue (https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-77183), I'm not sure... so here is it

For the _jira.subtask.quickcreateform.fields_ line in _jira-application.properties_ the field issuetype need always to be present, otherwise it crashes.

May I make suggestions then:
* The comments before the line (in _jira-application.properties_) should state this (that issuetype is mandatory), so users/admin wouldn't have to guess which field was making the crash.
* Could there have been a message instead of a crash, or a better message in the crash?

Thank you very much,
Nancy
fields.summary: jira.subtask.quickcreateform.fields line and field issuetype mandatory
Post Function Which Set Resolution Should Use Names Instead of IDs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24411].
  {panel}

Different results are obtained when retrieving an issue via the REST api compared to XML.   Attached are the results obtained from the following two URLs:
* GET http://jira.atlassian.com/si/jira.issueviews:issue-xml/JRA-23969/JRA-23969.xml
* GET http://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/latest/issue/JRA-23969

Observations:
* xml contains resolution, omitted from json (looking at other issues, I see that resolution is included in the json if the issue is actually resolved.   For unresolved issues, however, the value appears to be omitted)
* xml contains field values for Participants (customfield_10150), json contains no values for this field
* json contains values for "Support Request Message (IssueType:Bug)" (customfield_10250).  This field is shown in the xml with no corresponding ID and no value.
* json contains a field value for "Test Issue Creation Warning" (customfield_10301).  This field is shown in the xml with no value.
* json shows many more custom fields that aren't in XML (none appear to have a value associated with them, so perhaps that's why they're omitted?)
* json shows information about watchers; xml does not
* json shows fixVersion; xml does not unless there's a value
fields.summary: Issue retrieval via REST should be consistent with retrieval via XML
Improve semantic markup in User Browser table
Clean up pages visited without the correct path
"Test Connection" in the JIRA email setup process should give better feedback

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24368].
  {panel}

In statistics gadgets (Issue Statistics and Two Dimensional Filter Statistics), it will only show values if there are actually any issues associated with those values. It will not show possible values if there are zero issues associated. Let's say you have a field called 'Fruit' with 4 possible values : apple, banana, orange, grapes. Those gadgets will currently only show the first 3 rows below, not the last one. We need the last one to show , too. Same goes for columns, in a 2-dimensional gadget.
Fruit 	   Count
Apple 	1
Banana 	5
Orange 	3
Grapes 	0

Please see http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-9626 which was originally opened for this request in JIRA portlets. That request was closed because you no longer have 'portlets' but now you have gadgets. To be honest, we could have just renamed that request.... Anyway, here is the new request.
fields.summary: As a user I would like the option to show zero counts on statistics gadgets (Issue Statistics and Two Dimensional Filter Statistics)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24361].
  {panel}

I'm new to JIRA and GreenHopper, and it would save me a lot of time if I could click on "Help" from any screen in the application, and get context-sensitive help.

Currently, the only Help link is located in the dropdown list menu under my personal name.  (As a separate issue, it seems very unintuitive for me to look for Help under my personal name.  I would more likely expect it to exist as its own always-present menu, help being a pretty important component of a software package).

When I click on "Isaac Gartner -> Help" I'm taken to the homepage of JIRA Help, and I have to navigate to find the particular help I'm looking for.  I would prefer to be taken automatically to the help I'm looking for.

For example, I'm currently trying to learn GreenHopper, and I'm in the Planning Board.  I would like to be able to click on "Help" (the "Help" link would ideally would appear directly on the page, as mentioned above) and be taken directly to a page discussing the Planning Board screen of GreenHopper.
fields.summary: Context-sensitive help
stand alone catalina.sh should not pick up a global catalina setting

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24348].
  {panel}

In the way we've structured JIRA issues we have 'block' links mapping the progression of a project.

For instance:
Planning issue blocks Development issue
Development issue blocks QA issue
QA issue blocks Launch issue

The feature i'm looking for is someway for the assignee of the blocked issue to be notified when the blocking issue is resolved (or closed), so they know they can start work.

Currently I know of no way for the assignee of the blocked issue to get a notification when the blocking issue is resolved (or closed). The only way I know to do this is for the person to watch the issue, but that creates too much information flow, the assignee of the blocked issue just needs to know when they can start working (blocking issue is resolved or closed).

I'm not sure the best way to do this, so I'm open to your suggestions.
If anyone has found workarounds or there are plugins out there, please post those too.

Thanks,
fields.summary: Notifying assignee of linked issue when linked issue is resolved
be able to collapse and expand the list of dashboards
Filters Should Use Priorities ID's instead of Priorities Names

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24332].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 21 December 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hello All,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; however there are not currently any plans to implement this suggestion.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Gracias,
Otto Ruettinger
Principal Product Manager, JIRA
oruettinger (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}

\\

*Original description*
Similar to CONF-21982 it would be desirable to have the ability to retrieve LDAP properties for users.

We are using JIRA as a help desk system and have attached it to a Windows Active Directory LDAP server with a plug-in (https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/16524). The plug-in implements com.opensymphony.user.provider.CredentialsProvider, is able to authenticate the user, add group memberships and store custom user properties as PropertySet attributes in the JIRA database.

The custom properties are necessary for our support team and are displayed on the user profile and issue screen (ie. for phone dialing without using an external phone book application).

With JIRA 4.3 there is a possiblity to switch to the provided LDAP integration, but there seems to be no way to retrieve additional LDAP properties.

We have also investigated in using a separate Crowd installation and delegating user security to Crowd. It is possible to create user defined user and group properties in Crowd but these properties are not synchronized into the JIRA database.
fields.summary: Ability to retrieve LDAP properties for a JIRA user from external LDAP directory

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24322].
  {panel}

I would like to see a new feature added to be able to set the default on whether the email is sent or not when a new user is created.  In my instance we have a custom Single Sign On solution where we do not want a user to receive a notification when their JIRA account is created.  A setting in the Administration console under General Administration would be a good spot for it.

Another part of this is that we are specifically using the SOAP services to create users and it would be helpful to have a value that can be set in the API to turn emails on or off when creating that one user.

Thanks,
Justin
fields.summary: Ability to Turn On and Off User Creation Notification

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24289].
  {panel}

Repro-

-Search for items
-You get a list of bugs that match the items
-Open an item
-Click Next to navigate through the items
-Now move an item to a different project
the next and previous buttons go away and you're required to rerun the search.  But if you're in the middle of a 500 item list, try finding where you left off.  This makes management/administration of bugs very difficult especially when trying to triage a large list of issues to determine in which project a bug will be fixed.

If you move a bug, then click Next,and then click Previous (so that you would be on the bug that you just moved, it should just skip that bug.
fields.summary: Moving bugs/features should still allow the Next and Previous links to work from the original list of search results and not require you to rerun the search
On the Project page, add "Unresolved: By Issue Type" to the "Issues" tab when there are more than one Issue Type defined in a project
Force fancybox in gallery to use 'image' type
Make UserService.FieldName public so that plugins using Peace Harmony can add field errors without hard-coding field names.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24254].
  {panel}

Is there a way to change Linked Issue using Bulk Change operation?

Scenario: I have 10 issues linked to a Task and wanted to remove 5 issues and link it to another issue.
Is this possible using Bulk Change?

Thanks
Pallavi
fields.summary: Is there a way to change Linked Issue using Bulk Change operation?
Provide better feedback when no whitelist host is matched when the usermanagement API is probed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24242].
  {panel}

Due to a misconfiguration on the OS level, JIRA restarted.
At that moment it was re-indexing

When it came back up, most filters returned 0 results ...
This was resolved by running a reindex.


It would be an improvement to notify users/admin that a reindex operation 
was interrupted (for some reason)
fields.summary: Notifiy administrators that index is corrupt in case JIRA has been restarted while the reindex is running
A user can depend on issue auto transition to In Progress status when work is logged.
Provide the option to remove the Comment field from the Logging Work window

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24238].
  {panel}

The typical non-development task cycle at iDalko is as follows

* Put a task (a subtask of a story) 'in progress'
* Open the log window
* Start working on the task, keep track of activities in the log window
* At EOD/interrupt/task completion, enter the amount of time you have been working.
* Transition the task back to open or closed


We have to use the JIRA log work form to actually enter this information, 
because this form shows the time that the log work form has been opened
(start time)

It would be good if this could also be added to the greenhopper log window.
fields.summary: As a developer I can use the log work dialog box to measure time elapsed working on a task

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24237].
  {panel}

It does happen that I change the fixversion of a parent issue - while editing.
When I come back to the greenhopper task board, the parent issue will have any subtasks listed
(because the fixversion of the subtasks are still on the old value).

It would be handy to have an action 'repair subtask fix version ...' or something like that, which would iterate over all unresolved subtasks and modify the fixversion of the subtasks to be the version of the parent.
fields.summary: As a user I can 'repair fixversion of subtasks' after I changed the fixversion of a parent issue through the JIRA interface
As a GH user I would like my parent label to be reflected in my sub-tasks once the parent is updated to ensure that they are in sync
LDAP Delegated Authentication doesn't have any graphical user interface for user object filter
